Alverca|Alverca]] |youthyears3 = 2007–2012 | youthclubs3 = [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] |youthyears4 = 2009–2010 | youthclubs4 = → [[C.F. Os Belenenses|Belenenses]] (loan) |years1 = 2012–2014 | clubs1 = [[S.L. Benfica B|Benfica B]] | caps1 = 56 | goals1 = 22 |years2 = 2013–2015 | clubs2 = [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] | caps2 = 8 | goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2014–2015 | clubs3 = → [[Deportivo de La Coruña|Deportivo La Coruña]] (loan) | caps3 = 34 | goals3 = 3 |years4 = 2015–2016 | clubs4 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] | caps4 = 14 | goals4 = 1 |years5 = 2016 | clubs5 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco B]] | caps5 = 1 | goals5 = 1 |years6 = 2016– | clubs6 = [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] | caps6 = 89 | goals6 = 17 |nationalyears1 = 2010 | nationalteam1 = [[Portugal national under-17 football team|Portugal U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 8 | nationalgoals1 = 1 |nationalyears2 = 2011 | nationalteam2 = [[Portugal national under-18 football team|Portugal U18]] | nationalcaps2 = 4 | nationalgoals2 = 0 |nationalyears3 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam3 = [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal U19]] | nationalcaps3 = 22 | nationalgoals3 = 4 |nationalyears4 = 2012–2013 | nationalteam4 = [[Portugal national under-20 football team|Portugal U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 15 | nationalgoals4 = 1 |nationalyears5 = 2013–2015 | nationalteam5 = [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portugal U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 14 | nationalgoals5 = 7 |nationalyears6 = 2014– | nationalteam6 = [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] | nationalcaps6 = 2 | nationalgoals6 = 0 |club-update = 00:24, 12 February 2019 (UTC) |nationalteam-update = 30 June 2015 }}
'''Ivan Ricardo Neves Abreu Cavaleiro''' (born 18 October 1993) is a Portuguese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for English club [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]]. Mainly a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]], he can also play as a [[Forward (association football)|forward]].
A product of [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]]'s youth system, he was part of the club's domestic [[Treble (association football)|treble]] in the [[2013–14 S.L. Benfica season|2013–14 season]].
Cavaleiro earned 63 [[Cap (sport)|caps]] for [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] at youth level all categories comprised, scoring 13 goals. He made his senior international debut in 2014.
==Club career==
===Benfica=== Born in [[Vila Franca de Xira]], [[Lisbon District]], Cavaleiro played youth football for five clubs, notably representing [[S.L. Benfica]] from ages 13–18, a loan spell notwithstanding. He made his senior debut in the [[2012–13 Segunda Liga|2012–13 season]], playing his first [[Segunda Liga]] match with [[S.L. Benfica B|the reserves]] on 11 August 2012 against [[S.C. Braga B]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/benfica-b-sp-braga-b-2-2-andre-gomes-da-empate-nos-descontos-772861.html|title=Benfica B-Sp. Braga B, 2–2: André Gomes dá empate nos descontos|trans-title=Benfica B-Sp. Braga B, 2–2: André Gomes for the draw in injury time|newspaper=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|language=pt|date=11 August 2012|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> The following weekend he scored his first goal(s) as a professional, grabbing a brace in a 4–2 away win over [[C.D. Feirense]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/feirense-benfica-b-2-4-aguias-goleiam-com-bis-de-ivan-cavaleiro-774052.html|title=Feirense-Benfica B, 2–4: Águias goleiam com bis de Ivan Cavaleiro|trans-title=Feirense-Benfica B, 2–4: Eagles rout with Ivan Cavaleiro brace|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=19 August 2012|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> and added another two before the end of the month, in a 6–0 home routing of [[C.F. Os Belenenses]];<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/2--liga/detalhe/benfica-b-belenenses-goleada-na-luz-6-0-775375.html|title=Benfica B-Belenenses: Goleada na Luz (6–0)|trans-title=Benfica B-Belenenses: Routing at the Luz (6–0)|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=27 August 2012|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> he finished his first year with 38 appearances and 12 goals, helping his team to the seventh position.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.pt/futebol/futebol-nacional/liga-nos/benfica/detalhe/esforco-de-cavaleiro-ja-teve-a-recompensa-847981|title=Esforço de Cavaleiro já teve a recompensa|trans-title=Cavaleiro's effort has already paid off|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=19 October 2013|accessdate=7 October 2018}}</ref>
Cavaleiro started [[2013–14 Segunda Liga|his second season]] with Benfica B in fashion, netting seven times in ten matches and earning the ''Second Division Player of the Month'' award for August/September.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.ojogo.pt/futebol/1a-liga/benfica/noticias/interior/ivan-cavaleiro-foi-o-melhor-da-ii-liga-3480429.html|title=Ivan Cavaleiro foi o melhor da II Liga|trans-title=Ivan Cavaleiro was the best in II League|newspaper=[[O Jogo]]|language=pt|date=16 October 2013|accessdate=19 October 2013}}</ref> He made his official debut for the main squad on 19 October 2013, playing the full 90 minutes against CD Cinfães for the [[Taça de Portugal]] and [[Assist (football)|assisting]] [[Ola John]] for [[2013–14 Taça de Portugal|the game]]'s only goal;<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.jn.pt/desporto/interior/benfica-venceu-por-10-em-cinfaes-3486287.html|title=Benfica venceu por 1–0 em Cinfães|trans-title=Benfica won 1–0 in Cinfães|newspaper=[[Jornal de Notícias]]|language=pt|date=19 October 2013|accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> only four days later, he appeared in his maiden match in the [[UEFA Champions League]], playing the second half of a 1–1 home draw against [[Olympiacos F.C.]] for [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|the group stage]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000479/match=2011796/postmatch/report/index.html#cardozo+benficas+saviour|title=Cardozo the saviour as Benfica hold Olympiacos|publisher=UEFA|date=23 October 2013|accessdate=24 October 2013}}</ref>
On 15 January 2014, Cavaleiro scored his first competitive goal for Benfica, netting the last in a 2–0 win against [[Leixões S.C.]] for [[2013–14 Taça da Liga|the campaign]]'s [[Taça da Liga]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/Benfica//interior_premium.aspx?content_id=863084|title=Cavaleiro já fatura entre os "grandes"|trans-title=Cavaleiro already bagging it among "big boys"|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=16 January 2014|accessdate=17 January 2014}}</ref> On 7 August, he was loaned to [[Deportivo de La Coruña]] in the Spanish [[La Liga]] for one year,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.canaldeportivo.com/servlet/es.iris.servlets.Noticias?accion=4&ver=1&nid=28495&mid=12|title=Cavaleiro supera sin contratiempos los reconocimientos médicos y se incorpora al entrenamiento|trans-title=Cavaleiro overcomes medical smoothly and joins training|publisher=Deportivo La Coruña|language=es|date=8 August 2014|accessdate=8 August 2014}}</ref> making his debut on [[2014–15 La Liga|the first matchday]] and opening the scoring in a 1–2 defeat at [[Granada CF]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2014_15/primera/jornada_1/gda_dep/|title=El Granada ya muestra el oficio 'made in Caparrós'|trans-title=Granada already showing know-how 'made in Caparrós'|newspaper=[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]|last=Liceras|first=Ángel|language=es|date=23 August 2014|accessdate=8 November 2014}}</ref>
===Monaco=== On 10 July 2015, Cavaleiro joined [[AS Monaco FC]] on a permanent deal until 2020,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.slbenfica.pt/noticias/detalhedenoticia/tabid/2788/ArticleId/42342/language/pt-PT/.aspx|title=Ivan Cavaleiro no Mónaco até 2020|trans-title=Ivan Cavaleiro at Monaco until 2020|publisher=S.L. Benfica|language=pt|date=10 July 2015|access-date=10 July 2015}}</ref> for a transfer fee rumoured to be €15 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.abola.pt/clubes/ver.aspx?t=3&id=559297|title=Ivan Cavaleiro no Mónaco por 15 milhões de euros|trans-title=Ivan Cavaleiro to Monaco for 15 million euros|newspaper=[[A Bola]]|language=pt|date=10 July 2015|access-date=11 July 2015}}</ref> He made his debut on the 28th, starting in a 3–1 away win over [[BSC Young Boys]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|third qualifying round]] of [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|the Champions League]], and scored his first goal in the second leg, opening a 4–0 victory at the [[Stade Louis II]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1716/champions-league/2015/08/04/14165312/champions-league-round-up-ajax-crash-out-and-monaco-cruise|title=Champions League round-up: Ajax crash out and Monaco cruise through|publisher=[[Goal (website)|Goal]]|last=Creek|first=Stephen|date=4 August 2015|accessdate=5 August 2015}}</ref>
===Wolverhampton Wanderers=== On 31 August 2016, Cavaleiro moved to English [[Football League Championship|Championship]] side [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] on a five-year deal (with the option of an additional year) for an undisclosed fee, reported to be a new club-record sum of £7 million.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37236123|title=Ivan Cavaleiro: Wolves sign Monaco winger in record deal on five-year contract|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=31 August 2016|accessdate=31 August 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/wolves-sign-monacos-ivan-cavaleiro-11825300|title=Wolves sign Monaco's Ivan Cavaleiro for a club record £7 million fee|newspaper=[[Birmingham Mail]]|date=31 August 2016|accessdate=31 August 2016}}</ref> He made his debut on 10 September in a 1–1 home draw to [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37263310|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 1–1 Burton Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=10 September 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/wolves-vs-burton-alb/358181|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 1–1 Burton Albion|publisher=[[Sky Sports]]|date=10 September 2016|accessdate=16 December 2016}}</ref> and scored his first goal for the club 14 days later in a 3–1 win against [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] also at [[Molineux Stadium]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37392408|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 3–1 Brentford|publisher=BBC Sport|date=24 September 2016|accessdate=24 September 2016}}</ref>
Cavaleiro was voted the [[Professional Footballers' Association]] Fans' Championship Player of the Month for November 2017, after netting four times in as many games.<ref name=POTM>{{cite web|url=https://www.wolves.co.uk/news/first-team/20171206-cavaleiro-the-pfa-player-of-the-month/|title=Cavaleiro the PFA Player Of The Month|publisher=Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C|date=6 December 2017|accessdate=18 December 2017}}</ref> The previous month, he had provided five assists to keep his team clear at the top of [[2017–18 EFL Championship|the table]];<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/sport/football/wolverhampton-wanderers-fc/2017/10/19/the-stats-behind-wolves-flying-start-to-the-season/|title=The stats behind Wolves' flying start to the season|newspaper=[[Express & Star]]|date=19 October 2017|accessdate=18 December 2017}}</ref> he finished the season with nine goals from 42 appearances (adding 12 decisive passes), and achieved promotion to the [[Premier League]] as champion.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/how-much-wolves-star-ivan-14799537|title=How much Wolves star Ivan Cavaleiro is worth as Huddersfield Town fee speculation swirls|newspaper=[[Birmingham Mail]]|last=Kendrick|first=Mat|date=18 June 2018|accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref>
Cavaleiro's first match in the [[English football league system|English top division]] occurred on 29 September 2018, and he scored once in the 2–0 home victory over [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] with his very first touch of the ball after coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in place of compatriot [[Jota (footballer, born 1996)|Jota]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45610318|title=Wolverhampton Wanderers 2–0 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Poole|first=Harry|date=29 September 2018|accessdate=29 September 2018}}</ref>
==International career== [[File:Ivan Cavaleiro (7).jpg|200px|thumbnail|right|Cavaleiro playing for [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal U19]]]]
===Youth=== Cavaleiro was named in the [[Portugal national under-19 football team|Portugal under-19 squad]] at the [[2012 UEFA European Under-19 Football Championship|2012 UEFA European Championship]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rtp.pt/noticias/selecao-nacional/sub-19-convocados-para-europeu_d561608|title=Sub-19 – Convocados para Europeu|trans-title=Under-19 – European selection|publisher=[[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]]|language=pt|date=11 June 2012|accessdate=12 February 2018}}</ref> playing the last match of the group stage against [[Greece national under-19 football team|Greece]]. A year later, he represented [[Portugal national under-20 football team|the under-20 team]] at the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]: he appeared in four games as a substitute in [[Turkey]],<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259235/match=300232802/summary.html|title=Bruma brace denies Nigeria|publisher=FIFA|date=21 June 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259235/match=300232843/summary.html|title=Korea come from behind, hold Portugal|publisher=FIFA|date=24 June 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.fifa.com/u20worldcup/matches/round=259235/match=300232830/summary.html|title=Five-star Portugal cruise through|publisher=FIFA|date=27 June 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref> in an eventual [[Single-elimination tournament|round-of-16]] exit.
Cavaleiro made his debut for [[Portugal national under-21 football team|the under-21s]] on 14 August 2013, netting a [[hat-trick]] in a 5–2 [[Exhibition game|friendly]] win against [[Switzerland national under-21 football team|Switzerland]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/seleccao/portugal-suica-sub-21-golos-cronica/1480060-1194.html|title=Sub-21: Portugal–Suíça, 5–2 (crónica)|trans-title=Under-21: Portugal–Switzerland, 5–2 (match report)|publisher=Mais Futebol|language=pt|date=14 August 2013|accessdate=16 October 2013}}</ref> On 27 June 2015, he scored Portugal's third goal in a 5–0 win against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] in the semi-finals of the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|European Championship]] in Czech Republic;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000409/match=2015382/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Five-goal Portugal stun Germany in semi-finals|publisher=UEFA|last=Hart|first=Simon|date=27 June 2015|access-date=27 June 2015}}</ref> he was named in the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the tournament|Team of the Tournament]], in an eventual runner-up finish.<ref name="Team">{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/news/newsid=2262826.html|title=The official Under-21 Team of the Tournament|publisher=UEFA|date=1 July 2015|access-date=2 July 2015}}</ref>
===Senior=== On 28 February 2014, Cavaleiro received his first callup for the [[Portugal national football team|Portugal senior side]], for an exhibition game with [[Cameroon national football team|Cameroon]] on 5 March,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.publico.pt/desporto/noticia/rafa-e-ivan-cavaleiro-convocados-para-jogo-da-seleccao-com-os-camaroes-1626576|title=Rafa e Ivan Cavaleiro convocados para jogo da selecção com os Camarões|trans-title=Rafa and Ivan Cavaleiro called for national team game with Cameroon|newspaper=[[Público (Portugal)|Público]]|language=pt|date=28 February 2014|accessdate=2 March 2014}}</ref> starting and playing 70 minutes in the 5–1 win in [[Leiria]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/friendlies/season=2014/matches/round=2000374/match=2013713/postmatch/report/index.html#new+ronaldo+milestone|title=Ronaldo reaches new milestone in Portugal win|publisher=UEFA|date=5 March 2014|accessdate=6 March 2014}}</ref>
==Personal life== Cavaleiro's father, Lindo, was crowned Angolan youth champion for [[Atlético Petróleos de Luanda]], whilst his uncle Monhé excelled as a [[midfielder]] for [[Progresso Associação do Sambizanga]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.cmjornal.pt/desporto/detalhe/jorge-jesus-chama-ivan-cavaleiro|title=Jorge Jesus chama Ivan Cavaleiro|trans-title=Jorge Jesus calls Ivan Cavaleiro|newspaper=[[Correio da Manhã]]|language=pt|date=14 October 2013|accessdate=21 June 2017}}</ref>
==Club statistics== {{updated|match played on 2 March 2019}}<ref>{{Soccerway|ivan-cavaleiro/191597|accessdate=6 January 2018}}</ref> {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan="2"|Domestic League !colspan="2"|Cup{{ref label|A|A}} !colspan="2"|Continental{{ref label|B|B}} !colspan="2"|Other{{ref label|C|C}} !colspan="2"|Total |- !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals !Apps !Goals |- |rowspan="3" valign="center"|[[S.L. Benfica B|Benfica B]] |[[2012–13 Segunda Liga|2012–13]] |38||12||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||38||12 |- |[[2013–14 Segunda Liga|2013–14]] |18||10||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||18||10 |- !Total !56!!22!!colspan="2"|—!!colspan="2"|—!!colspan="2"|—!!56!!22 |- | valign="center"|[[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]] |[[2013–14 S.L. Benfica season|2013–14]] |8||0||2||0||6||0||3||1||19||1 |- | valign="center"|[[Deportivo de La Coruña|Deportivo]] |[[2014–15 Deportivo de La Coruña season|2014–15]] |34||3||0||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||34||3 |- |rowspan="3" valign="center"|[[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] |[[2015–16 AS Monaco FC season|2015–16]] |12||1||0||0||6||2||1||0||19||3 |- |[[2016–17 AS Monaco FC season|2016–17]] |2||0||0||0||1||0||colspan="2"|—||3||0 |- !Total !14!!1!!0!!0!!7!!2!!1!!0!!21!!3 |- |[[AS Monaco FC|Monaco B]] |[[2015–16 Championnat de France Amateur|2015–16]] |1||1||colspan=6|—||1||1 |- |rowspan="4" valign="center"|[[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] |[[2016–17 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2016–17]] |31||5||0||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||31||5 |- |[[2017–18 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2017–18]] |42||9||4||0||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||46||9 |- |[[2018–19 Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C. season|2018–19]] |19||3||5||2||colspan="2"|—||colspan="2"|—||24||5 |- !Total !92!!17!!9!!2!!0!!0!!colspan="2"|—!!101!!19 |- !colspan="2"|Career total !205!!44!!11!!2!!13!!2!!4!!1!!232!!49 |}
{{refbegin}} :A. {{note|A}} Includes appearances in the [[Taça de Portugal]] and [[Copa del Rey]] with [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], and [[EFL Cup]] & [[FA Cup]] with [[Wolverhampton Wanderers|Wolves]]. :B. {{note|B}} Includes appearances in the [[UEFA Champions League]] and [[UEFA Europa League]]. :C. {{note|C}} Includes appearances in the [[Taça da Liga]] and [[Coupe de la Ligue]]. {{refend}}
==Honours== '''Benfica''' *[[Primeira Liga]]: [[2013–14 Primeira Liga|2013–14]] *[[Taça de Portugal]]: [[2013–14 Taça de Portugal|2013–14]] *[[Taça da Liga]]: [[2013–14 Taça da Liga|2013–14]] *[[UEFA Europa League]] runner-up: [[2013–14 UEFA Europa League|2013–14]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuropaleague/season=2014/matches/round=2000474/match=2012680/postmatch/report/index.html#spot+sevilla+leave+benfica+dreams+tatters|title=Spot-on Sevilla leave Benfica dreams in tatters|publisher=UEFA|date=14 May 2014|accessdate=15 May 2014}}</ref>
'''Wolverhampton Wanderers''' *[[EFL Championship]]: [[2017–18 EFL Championship|2017–18]]<ref>{{cite book|editor-first=John|editor-last=Anderson|title=Football Yearbook 2018–2019|year=2018|publisher=Headline Publishing Group|location=London|isbn=978-1-4722-6106-9|pages=386–387}}</ref>
'''Portugal U21''' *[[UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] runner-up: [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2015]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000411/match=2015383/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Spot-on Sweden beat Portugal to win U21 EURO|publisher=UEFA|last=Kell|first=Tom|date=30 June 2015|accessdate=1 October 2018}}</ref>
'''Individual''' *[[SJPF Segunda Liga Player of the Month]]: August 2013, September 2013 *UEFA European Under-21 Championship Team of the tournament: [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship#Team of the tournament|2015]]<ref name="Team"/> *[[Professional Footballers' Association]] Fans' Championship Player of the Month: November 2017<ref name=POTM/>
